alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 4:31PM MST until August 18 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... eastern Coconino County in Arizona... west central Navajo County in Arizona... * Until 730 PM MST. * At 429 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain west of Seba and northeast of Leupp. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tolani Lake, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 87 between mile markers 380 and 382. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oraibi Wash, Tees Toh Wash, Polacca Wash, Coyote Wash and Jeddito Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
